isis.stitle: 9 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS EATON RT-8609 SERIES - INSTALL - LEFT COUNTERSHAFT ASSEMBLY

important.para: Mark the countershaft drive gear for timing purposes. On the drive gear of each countershaft assembly, mark the tooth aligned with the keyway of the gear and stamped with an "O" for easy identification ( Figure 192). A highly visible color of toolmaker's dye is recommended for making timing marks.

figure.caption: Figure 192. Mark Teeth for Timing Purposes

step1.para: Place the left countershaft assembly into position in the case ( Figure 193).

figure.caption: Figure 193. Place Left Countershaft Assembly into Position

step1.para: Move the left countershaft assembly to the rear and insert the countershaft support tool, or block, to center the shaft in the rear case bore ( Figure 194).

figure.caption: Figure 194. Insert Countershaft Support Tool or Block to Center Shaft in Rear Case Bore

step1.para: Install the front bearing on the countershaft and in the case bore, with flanged driver ( Figure 195).

figure.caption: Figure 195. Install Front Bearing on Countershaft

step1.para: Install the rear bearing on the countershaft and in the case bore, with flanged driver ( Figure 196).

figure.caption: Figure 196. Install Rear Bearing on Countershaft

step1.para: Install the snap ring in the groove in the rear bore of the case ( Figure 197).

figure.caption: Figure 197. Install Snap Ring in Groove in Rear Bore of Case
